cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the classical scheduling problem, which is a fundamental problem in computer science and operations research. The paper provides new reductions from 3SAT to the scheduling problem, which is a common technique in the design and analysis of approximation algorithms. The paper also uses the Exponential Time Hypothesis (ETH) to prove the optimality of the existing approximation schemes, which is a topic of interest in computational complexity theory. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory). The paper also involves techniques from information theory (cs.IT) and machine learning (cs.LG), which are less likely but still relevant sub-categories.
